text: Terry Kuny CURRICULUM VITÆ 240 Fairmont Ave, Ottawa ON K1Y 1X9 819.319.2665 ​ ◉ ​ ​ <EMAIL> ​ ​ ◉ ​ ​ www.kuny.ca Facebook ​ | ​ Twitter ​ | ​ LinkedIn ​ | ​ ​ LibraryThing What Am I About? My professional goal has been to help organizations connect with their communities through the appropriate & effective ​ use of technology. To do this, I bring strong research, analytical, creative and humanist approaches to: ● strategic business and project planning, ● critical assessment of trends, technologies, risks & opportunities for services deployment, ● information architectures and business processes, ● expert communications skills. I have provided these services to: ● 25+ government departments and agencies, ● international organizations including IFLA, NISO, and UNESCO, ● cultural sector organizations (libraries, museums, archives), ● industry groups and small- and medium-sized enterprises, ● non-profit sector. After 25 years in the private sector, I joined the public service in 2015. I am currently developing and managing Drupal-based web services, social media, and online consultations with the Canadian Transportation Agency. I am an experienced public speaker and communicator. I have spoken nationally and internationally to many professional groups on a variety of subjects. Through my information architecture practice, I have conducted dozens of focus groups and stakeholder engagement sessions, stakeholder survey design, observational task analysis, and UX testing. I am a regular participant in various GC communities. I provide care and feeding of DIGLIB, an international community for digital library research and development. My professional research interests are: ● UX and design research; ● commitment to open access to information and open software; ● social media developments, standards & tools; ● interoperability & metadata standards (classification, thesauri, vocabulary); ● social and web metrics & performance indicators; and ● information policy. Communications skills • National and international public speaking and presentation experience. • Extensive experience in professional, technical and web writing. • Speechwriting for senior management. • Extensive experience in providing professional and technical training. • Social media planning and management. • Survey development and implementation. Standards and best practices • Familiarity with current government web standards and policies. • Responsive design practices and mobile interface design practices. • WCAG 2.0 AA, HTML and PDF accessibility tools and techniques. • Code skills: HTML5 /XHTML/ XML / CSS, Javascript (basic), jQuery (basic), PHP (basic), WET4 and Bootstrap3 • ePub3 and iBooks authoring • Metadata standards including Dublin Core, METS, MODS, identifier standards including DOI, PURL, OpenURL, MARC 21. • Resource discovery standards & applications (OAI, RDF, Z39.50). • Mail and news standards (SMTP/MIME/NNTP, RSS-ATOM syndication). • P2P sharing protocols, cloud services (DropBox, iCloud, among others). Technical Skills • Mac OS X, UNIX (BSD), LAMP stack (basics), Windows variants operating systems. • Web and social media analytics: Hootsuite, Google Analytics, Piwik, search engine optimization strategies. • Major word-processing/DTP packages: MS-Word, CSS and HTML editors, InDesign, Acrobat, Dreamweaver, iLife suite, etc. • Graphics/presentation programs: PowerPoint, KeyNote, Photoshop, Inkscape. • Multimedia: podcasting, basic level DVD and video preparation. • Survey tools: SurveyMonkey, FluidSurveys, LimeSurvey • PDF Acrobat Pro and Livecycle (Basic-Intermediate) including PDF WCAG 2.0 AA accessibility. • Internet server and applications: Apache, indexing tools, basic Solr, mail & list serving, Google search app. • CMS: Drupal, WordPress, B2Evo, basic familiarity with TeamSite and Adobe AEM • Variety of open source applications for surveys, blogs, wikis and other specialized applications including active participation in GCConnex and GCPedia • Podcasting with Garageband, screencasting with Camtasia, SnagIt • Digitization technologies scanning, OCR, standards and workflows. • Database management systems: MySQL, Filemaker • Extensive photographic experience Information retrieval & analysis • Professional research and analytical skills • Extensive familiarity with Internet retrieval services. • On-line database services & CD-ROM databases, including DIALOG, Sage, PLOS, Medline, ERIC, et.al. • Statistical/spreadsheet packages - Microsoft Excel, SPSS, Systat & Statview.
